params.text:
• Acquire expressions and accompany the visitor
  • Offer to book a taxi
  • Exchange small talk and say goodbye

Welcoming Visitors

Say goodbye to the visitor

Language in Action
Welcoming Visitors: Introduction

In this module, we'll explore how to end your interaction with visitors on a positive note. 

Here's what you'll cover:

1. Expressions: Learn useful phrases to express goodbyes and well wishes.

  2. Accompaniment: Explore strategies for accompanying visitors to their exit point.

  3. Taxi Booking: Practice offering to book a taxi for visitors if needed.

  4. Small Talk: Discover conversation starters for a pleasant goodbye exchange.
Acquire Expressions And Accompany The Visitor

metadata.title: Acquire Expressions And Accompany The Visitor - Interactive Video

params.text: Please watch the following video and answer the questions:
Acquire Expressions: Key Points
Please click on the info points to see useful strategies you can use:
Express Gratitude:
Offer Further Assistance:
Accompany to Exit (Optional):
Goodbye Expressions:
Small Talk (Optional):
• Thank the visitor for their time and visit.
• Use clear and friendly phrases to say goodbye.
• Briefly mention something related to their visit for a natural goodbye flow.
• See if they need anything else before they leave.
• If appropriate, offer to walk them to the door or reception area.
Acquire Expressions And Accompany The Visitor: Sentences

params.textField:
Do you need *help* booking a taxi? 
Would you *like* me to call a taxi for you? 
Are you planning on taking a taxi back to your *hotel*? 
No problem, I can call a *taxi* for you right away. 
The taxi *stand* is located just outside the building, if you prefer. 
Here's my phone number in *case* you have any trouble with the taxi.

metadata.title: Offer To Book A Taxi - Drag the words

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Why does the receptionist ask the visitor if they need help?
answers:
To see if the visitor needs anything before they leave.  

Because the receptionist wants to go home too.  

Because the receptionist forgot something important.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does the receptionist offer to do for the visitor?
answers:
Call a taxi for them.  

Book a train ticket for them.  

Take them to the airport personally.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does the receptionist ask the visitor about taxis?
answers:
If they want a regular taxi or a ride-sharing service.  

What color taxi they prefer.  

How much money they have for the taxi fare.

params.text: Offer To Book A Taxi: Conversation and Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions:
Dialogue Text:

Receptionist: Thank you for visiting Hart Trading today. Can I help you with anything else before you leave?

Visitor: No, thank you, I think I'm all set. Do you have a taxi stand nearby?

Receptionist: We don't have a taxi stand here, but I can call a taxi for you if you'd like. Would you prefer a regular taxi or a ride-sharing service?
Receptionist:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Abigail:
What Would You Say? Quiz

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: Your visitor seems lost after your conversation about where to go. What would you do?
answers:
Briefly explain the directions again and offer to walk them to the exit if it's in the

Say goodbye and let them find their way on their own.  

Tell them you're busy and they should ask someone else for help.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: The visitor you are saying goodbye to mentions they have an important meeting to get to, and they seem a little stressed. What can you say?
answers:
Acknowledge their stress and offer a quick reassurance, like "I'm sure your meeting will go well!"  

Ask them detailed questions about the meeting, which might make them more stressed.  

Tell them funny stories to lighten the mood, but they might not be appropriate for a professional setting.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: You are saying goodbye to a visitor and they ask you for your business card. What should you do?
answers:
Offer them your business card and thank them for visiting.  

Tell them you don't have any business cards 

Ask them why they want your business card and seem hesitant to give it to them.

params.text: Use your skills to answer the following questions!
Exchange Small Talk and Say Goodbye: Key Points
Please click on the info points to see useful strategies you can use:
Show Interest:
Positive Comment:
Future Connection:
Goodbye Wishes:
Keep it Brief:
• Briefly ask a question about their visit or something related to their work.
• Use a clear and friendly goodbye phrase.
• Small talk for goodbyes should be short and sweet.
• Mention something positive about their visit or interaction.
• Briefly mention how you might stay connected, like exchanging business cards or following them on social media (if appropriate).
Exchange Small Talk And Say Goodbye: Sentences

metadata.title: Exchange Small Talk And Say Goodbye - Drag the words

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does Abigail ask Bryan about his visit?
answers:
If he found anything interesting during his visit.  

If he needs help finding the bathroom.  

If he wants to buy any of the company's products.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: Why does Abigail give Bryan her business card?
answers:
So he can stay connected and ask her questions later.  

Because she wants him to buy something from her.  

Because she forgot to give it to him earlier.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does Bryan say to Abigail at the end of the conversation?
answers:
He thanks her and says it was a good meeting.  

He asks her for her phone number.  

He tells her he doesn't think the presentation was helpful.

params.text: Offer To Book A Taxi: Conversation and Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions:
Dialogue Text:

Abigail: Thank you again for visiting our office today. Was there anything in particular you found helpful?

Bryan: Absolutely! The presentation about your marketing strategies was very informative.

Abigail: I'm glad to hear that! We're always happy to share our knowledge. Here's my business card in case you have any further questions.

Bryan: Thank you. It was a pleasure meeting you. Have a great day!
Abigail:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Bryan:
Module Summary Quiz

Test your instruction-following skills!
Choose the BEST answer for each question to show what you learned in this module.

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: How can you express gratitude to a visitor for their time?
answers:
Thank them for coming and for their visit.  

Tell them you're glad they're finally leaving.  

Ask them if they are sure they don't need anything else before you leave work.

choices.question: Question 2 of 6: What is an example of a friendly goodbye phrase?
answers:
"Have a safe trip back!"  

"Goodbye and don't come back."  

"See you tomorrow!"

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: What is a good way to offer to book a taxi for a visitor?
answers:
Ask them if they need help booking a taxi or would prefer to find one on their own.  

Tell them the taxi stand is far away and they should call one themselves.  

Ask them for their money so you can pay for the taxi ride.

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: If a visitor asks about a taxi stand, you can:
answers:
Tell them the location of the nearest taxi stand.  

Ignore their question and continue with another topic. 

Explain that your company policy forbids visitors from taking taxis.

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: What is an appropriate way to start small talk when saying goodbye to a visitor?
answers:
Briefly mention something related to their visit or work.  

Ask them personal questions about their family life.  

Tell them a long joke that might make them miss their flight.

choices.question: Question 6 of 6: How can you keep your goodbye small talk brief and professional?
answers:
Keep your comments positive and focus on the visit itself.  

Ask them detailed questions about their travel plans.  

Start talking about your personal plans for the weekend.
